    About me

    Hello, this is Khan Md Hasib and I am from Bangladesh, a small country with eternal beauty, located in South Asia.

    I have received my M.Sc. degree from the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Brac University, Dhaka, Bangladesh. I also have completed my B.Sc. from the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Ahsanullah University of Science & Technology(AUST), Dhaka, Bangladesh.

    I'm currently pursuing Ph.D. degree with the Department of Computer Science and Software Engineering, The University of Western Australia, Crawley, WA 6009, Australia. I also involved as a Lead Researcher at Advanced Machine Intelligence Research Lab (AMIRL) where research network comprises several leading academicians and scientists from Universities and Industries from different continents. Formerly, I worked as an Assistant Professor at Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Bangladesh University of Business and Technology (BUBT), Dhaka, Bangladesh.

    I consider working in a large field of Artificial Intelligence specially on Natural Language Processing. My research works are intended to tackle low resource NLP, covering areas like natural language generation, summarization, question answering (QA), and interpretability of language models. I have utilized cutting-edge techniques like generative and contrastive learning to improve language generation and representation learning for low resource language. Additionally, I have applied natural language processing in specific software engineering (SE) tasks. At present, I am investigating bias, fairness and adversarial robustness in PLMs and LLMs.

    Details of my academic records, research experience, professional and synergistic activities can be found in my extended CV. Anyone who wishes to know more about me or my interests and to find more information about my work please feel free to contact me anytime through the contact.

    This website contains information about the courses I am currently instructing, the course materials, my research interests, links to my papers, and some of my most memorable moments. I appreciate your visit to my website.
